com.spotify.flo.context

Class MemoizingContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spotify.flo.context.ForwardingEvalContext
      • com.spotify.flo.context.MemoizingContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EvalContext

    public class MemoizingContext
extends ForwardingEvalContext
    A flo EvalContext that allows task types to define custom memoization strategies.

    This context can be used to extend the EvalContext.evaluate(Task) algorithm with memoization behaviours specific to the Task.type(). This is specially useful when a type is backed by a an out-of-process store of some sort (database, service, etc).

    By returning a value from MemoizingContext.Memoizer.lookup(Task), this context will stop further evaluation of that tasks upstreams and short-circuit the evaluation algorithm at that task node. The resolved value will be used as input to dependent tasks

    Example 

    
   Tasks a, b and c depend on each other in a chain: a -> b -> c.
   // a depends on b, b depends on c

   When calling context.evaluate(a), this will be the sequence of calls made:
   context.evaluate(a)
   aMemoizer.lookup(a) => empty()
   context.evaluate(b)
   bMemoizer.lookup(b) => empty()
   context.evaluate(c)
   cMemoizer.lookup(c) => empty()
   cValue = context.invokeProcessFn(c, c.fn)
   cMemoizer.store(c, cValue)
   bValue = context.invokeProcessFn(b, b.fn)
   bMemoizer.store(b, bValue)
   aValue = context.invokeProcessFn(a, a.fn)
   aMemoizer.store(a, aValue)

   However, if any of the lookup calls return a value, the evaluation will short-circuit:
   context.evaluate(a)
   aMemoizer.lookup(a) => empty()
   context.evaluate(b)
   bMemoizer.lookup(b) => 'foo'
   // no expansion of upstreams to b
   aValue = context.invokeProcessFn(a, a.fn)
   aMemoizer.store(a, aValue)

    MemoizingContext.Memoizer implementations are discovered through the MemoizingContext.Memoizer.Impl annotations on a static method on the task type that should have the signature public static Memoizer<T> memoizer(). The MemoizingContext.Memoizer type argument there should match the memoized type itself.

      • evaluateInternal

        public <T> EvalContext.Value<T> evaluateInternal(Task<T> task,
                                                 EvalContext context)
        Description copied from interface: EvalContext
        A variant of EvalContext.evaluate(Task) that allows the caller to specify the EvalContext that should be used within the graph during evaluation.

        This is intended to be called from EvalContext implementations that form a composition of other contexts.

        Specified by:
        evaluateInternal in interface EvalContext
        Overrides:
        evaluateInternal in class ForwardingEvalContext
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the task result
        Parameters:
        task - The task to evaluate
        context - The context to use in further evaluation
        Returns:
        A value of the task result

      • invokeProcessFn

        public <T> EvalContext.Value<T> invokeProcessFn(TaskId taskId,
                                                Fn<T> processFn)
        Description copied from interface: EvalContext
        Invoke the process function of a task.

        This method will be called when the process function of a task is ready to be invoked. This gives this EvalContext the responsibility of invoking user code. By overriding this method, one can intercept the evaluation flow just at the moment between inputs being ready and when the user supplied function for task processing is being invoked.

        The default implementation will simply invoke the function immediately inside a EvalContext.Value created by EvalContext.value(Fn).

        Specified by:
        invokeProcessFn in interface EvalContext
        Overrides:
        invokeProcessFn in class ForwardingEvalContext
        Type Parameters:
        T - The task value type
        Parameters:
        taskId - The id of the task being invoked
        processFn - A lazily evaluated handle to the process function
        Returns:
        The (deferred) value of the process function invocation
